extractions.description: This paper introduces EkoHate, a dataset designed specifically to detect abusive language and hate speech in code-switched political discussions on Nigerian Twitter. The paper evaluates state-of-the-art methods on this dataset under both supervised and cross-lingual transfer learning settings.

type.justification: The paper involves creating a dataset, performing experiments with state-of-the-art models, and providing empirical evaluation results.
type.quote: We analysed our dataset and provided an empirical evaluation of state-of-the-art methods across both supervised and cross-lingual transfer learning settings.
